data.title: Fill in the blanks with the right word: is, am, are
data.text: Peter Baker *is* from Manchester, but Paul and John *are* from London. Manchester and London *are* cities in England. Hamburg *is* a city in Germany. Sandra  *is* at school today. Jack and Peter *are* her friends. They *are* in the same class. Mr and Mrs Baker *are* on a trip to the USA to visit their cousin Anne. She  *is* a nice girl. Peter says: "My grandfather  *is* in hospital. I *am* at home with my grandmother." What time *is* it? It *is* 8 o'clock. *are* you tired? No, I *am* not.

data.title: Fill in the blanks with the right word: has, have, had
data.text:
I *have* many friends.
We *had* a big house when I was a kid.
Spring *has* six crayons.
A rabbit *has* long ears.
Do you *have* a balloon.
This bird *has* red wings.
Geron *had* fun at the party last night.
Calyx *has* a new toy.

data.title: Fill in the blanks with I and me.
data.text:
Could you pass *me* the salt?
*I* don't want to go out now.
Vinoth and *I* are going to the movies.
Am *I* invited?
She gave *me* some coins.

data.title: Fill in the blanks with we and us.
data.text:
Let *us* cross the road.
Can *we* all go to the swimming pool tomorrow?
*We* were talking to the principal.
Thank you for driving *us* to the market.
The teacher asked *us* to form a circle.

data.title: Fill in the blanks with she and her.
data.text:
I gave *her* the books.
*She* doesn't have a pen.
*She* is so clever.
If I tell Roshima, *she* might tell Sunitha.
I will talk to *her* about this issue.

data.title: Fill in the blanks with they and them.
data.text:
We asked *them* to keep the door open.
If you build it, *they* will come.
*They* are very nice people.
What do *they* want?
I have lost my keys. I can't find *them* anywhere.

data.title: Fill in the blanks with he and him.
data.text:
If you see David, give *him* these books.
Does *he* want some coffee?
*He* is a wise man.
Did Mohan get the promotion *he* wanted?
I didn't recognize *him*.
